eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Entropy, @VictrisGames
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Throw an object that returns to the thrower after a length of time, or when an action is used to return it.

How to throw a boomerang: 
-- Create a bomerang object that has this behavior
-- Use one of the "Throw boomerang..." actions
-- Run the "Track location of thrower" action every frame so the boomerang returns correctly

Tips:
- If you want the boomerang to bounce off objects, check for collisions and then use the action "Send boomerang back to thrower"
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Boomerang
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Throw an object that returns to the thrower like a boomerang

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Throw an object that returns to the thrower like a boomerang
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: Boomerang

events.comment: Check if it is time for the boomerang to head back to thrower
Boomerang should head back toward thrower
Use an instant force so boomerang can't miss the thrower
Always rotate boomerang

eventsFunctions.description: Throw boomerang toward an angle
eventsFunctions.name: ThrowBoomerangAngle
eventsFunctions.sentence: Throw boomerang _PARAM0_ toward angle _PARAM2_ degrees, speed of _PARAM3_ pixels per second, rotating _PARAM5_ degrees per second, and send boomerang back after of _PARAM4_ seconds

events.comment: Set properties of boomerang
Use a permanent force to move boomerang until it is stopped
Make boomerang appear to travel in a narrow ellipse
Reset the timer of the boomerang

eventsFunctions.description: Throw boomerang toward a position
eventsFunctions.name: ThrowBoomerangPosition
eventsFunctions.sentence: Throw boomerang _PARAM0_ toward _PARAM2_;_PARAM3_ at a speed of _PARAM4_ pixels per second, rotating _PARAM6_ degrees per second, and send boomerang back after of _PARAM5_ seconds

events.comment: Set properties of boomerang
Use a permanent force to move boomerang until it is stopped
Make boomerang appear to travel in a narrow ellipse
Reset the timer of the boomerang

eventsFunctions.description: Send boomerang back to thrower
eventsFunctions.name: ReturnBoomerang

events.comment: Stop the permanent force that was used to send the boomerang outward
Make boomerang appear to travel in a narrow ellipse

eventsFunctions.description: Set amount of time before boomerang changes directions (seconds)
eventsFunctions.fullName: Set amount of time before boomerang changes directions
eventsFunctions.name: SetReturnTime
eventsFunctions.sentence: Set amount of time before _PARAM0_ changes directions to _PARAM2_ (seconds)

eventsFunctions.description: Track position of boomerang thrower
eventsFunctions.name: TrackingThrower
eventsFunctions.sentence: Track position of thrower _PARAM2_ who threw boomerang _PARAM0_

eventsFunctions.description: Boomerang is returning to thrower
eventsFunctions.name: IsBoomerangReturning

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
How To Use:
- Place target objects in the scene in the places you want fill objects to be created
- This action only needs to be run once (at the beginning of the scene or using TriggerOnce)

Object variables (Fill objects): 
- "CreationID" (number)
- "RowID" (number)
- "ColumnID" (number)
- "BatchID" (text)

Tips:
- Use fill objects that are the same size as the scene editor grid.  This will make sure the fill objects fit exactly inside the target objects.
- Hide target objects at the beginning of the scene if you don't want them to be visible.
- Keep the default origin point (top-left corner) on fill objects them to line up exactly with target objects.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: RectangularFloodFill
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Create fill objects that cover the rectangular area of target objects

eventsFunctions.description: Create fill objects that cover the rectangular area of target objects
eventsFunctions.name: RectangularFloodFill
eventsFunctions.sentence: Create _PARAM2_ objects that will cover _PARAM1_ objects.  Space between rows:  _PARAM3_  Space between columns: _PARAM4_ Layer: _PARAM5_ Z-order: _PARAM6_ BatchID: _PARAM7_

events.comment: Initialize variables
Create a temp object to determine size of fill object, then delete it
Create permanent objects using the Create Multiple Copies of Object extension

parameters.longDescription: Rectangular area that will be covered by fill objects
parameters.name: TargetObject

parameters.longDescription: Object that is created to cover the rectangular area of target objects
parameters.name: FillObject

eventsFunctions.description:
Create multiple copies of an object.
Select the object, choose the number of rows and columns, the spacing between rows and columns, the top left starting point, the layer to create the objects on, and the z-order of the objects.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Create multiple copies of an object
eventsFunctions.name: CreateMultipleCopiesOfObject
eventsFunctions.sentence: Create _PARAM2_ rows and _PARAM3_ columns of _PARAM1_ objects, with top-left starting position _PARAM4_;_PARAM5_, with _PARAM6_px between rows and _PARAM7_px between columns. Create objects on _PARAM9_ with a Z-value of _PARAM10_. Assign all objects the BatchID of _PARAM8_.

events.comment: Temp object is created to record its width and height (which is needed to calculate spacing).
Temp variables to track progress in drawing the grid
Starting at top left, create objects in grid.
If the current row is complete, move to the next row.
If the last row is complete, stop creating new objects.

parameters.description: (Optional) Identifier assigned to all objects created in this batch
parameters.name: BatchID

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description: Force the object to stay visible on the screen by setting back its position inside the viewport of the camera.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: StayOnScreen
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Force the object to stay visible on the screen by setting back its position inside the viewport of the camera.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Force the object to stay visible on the screen by setting back its position inside the viewport of the camera.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: StayOnScreen

parameters: min(max(Object.X(), CameraX(Object.Layer(), 0) - CameraWidth(Object.Layer(), 0)/2 + Object.Behavior::PropertyMarginLeft()), CameraX(Object.Layer(), 0) + CameraWidth(Object.Layer(), 0)/2 - Object.Behavior::PropertyMarginRight())

min(max(Object.Y(), CameraY(Object.Layer(), 0) - CameraHeight(Object.Layer(), 0)/2+ Object.Behavior::PropertyMarginTop()), CameraY(Object.Layer(), 0) + CameraHeight(Object.Layer(), 0)/2- Object.Behavior::PropertyMarginBottom())

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Silver-Streak, @Bouh, Tristan Rhodes
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
This extension adds conditions to check if an object is located within the visible portion of its layer's camera. The condition also allows for specifying padding to the virtual screen border.

Note that this does not take into account any object visibility, such as being hidden or 0 opacity, but can be combined with those existing conditions.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: IsOnScreen
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: This adds a condition to detect if an object is on screen based off its current layer.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
This behavior provides a condition to check if the object is located within the visible portion of its layer's camera. The condition also allows for specifying padding to the virtual screen border.
Note that object visibility, such as being hidden or 0 opacity, is not considered (but you can use those existing conditions in addition to this behavior).
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: InOnScreen

eventsFunctions.description: Checks if an object position is within the viewport of its layer.
eventsFunctions.name: IsOnScreen

parameters.longDescription: Number of pixels to pad the screen border. Zero by default. A negative value go inside the screen, a positive value go outside.
parameters.name: Padding

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @Lizard-13
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
An action which, when applied on some objects, snap these objects to a *virtual grid*, with cells having customizable width and height.

Useful for level editors or putting objects on a tiled based map (RPG, strategy games, or any tiled based game in general).
eventsFunctionsExtensions.fullName: Snap objects to a virtual grid
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: SnapToGrid
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Action to snap objects to a virtual grid during the game.

eventsFunctions.description: Snap object to a virtual grid (i.e: this is not the grid used in the editor)
eventsFunctions.fullName: Snap objects to a virtual grid
eventsFunctions.name: SnapObjectToVirtualGrid
eventsFunctions.sentence: Snap _PARAM1_ to a virtual grid using cells with  width: _PARAM2_px, height _PARAM3_px and an offset position (_PARAM4_; _PARAM5_)

events.comment: Round the Object position to snap to the in-game grid

parameters.description: Objects to snap to the virtual grid
parameters.name: Object

parameters.description: Width of a cell of the virtual grid (in pixels)
parameters.name: CellWidth

parameters.description: Height of a cell of the virtual grid (in pixels)
parameters.name: CellHeight

parameters.description: Offset on the X axis of the virtual grid (in pixels)
parameters.name: OffsetX

parameters.description: Offset on the Y axis of the virtual grid (in pixels)
parameters.name: OffsetY

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Arthur Pacaud (arthuro555)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
> Note: This extension is currently made in JavaScript instead of the event sheet as variables cannot be passed to events based functions yet. Due to this hack, the extension **only works on root scene variables**, not on child variables or non-scene variables.

This extension adds features like:
- Combining arrays (concatenate into new array, append all children to another array)
- Finding a value in an array (find index expression, contains condition)
- Reversing arrays
- Get a portion of an array (slice)
- Add and remove lots of children at specific indices at once (fill, splice, shift, pop, add at index)
- Randomness (shuffle children, get a random child)
- Mathematical operations using arrays (sum of all numbers, biggest/smallest number, average number, median number)
- Sort numbers in an array
- String inter-operation (split string into array, join array array children to string)

eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: A collection of utilities and tools for working with arrays

eventsFunctions.description: Get the sum of all numbers in an array.
eventsFunctions.name: Sum

events.inlineCode:
eventsFunctionContext.returnValue = runtimeScene
    .getVariables()
    .get(eventsFunctionContext.getArgument("arr"))
    .getAllChildrenArray()
    .reduce((accumulator, current) => accumulator + current.getAsNumber(), 0);

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @Bouh, D8H
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
This extension provides: 
- Conditions to check if a global/scene/object variable exists.
- Actions to copy object variables.
- Actions to delete an existing global/scene variable from memory.
- Actions to create a global/scene variable using a text expression, rather than a variable name.
- Expressions to get the value or text from a global/scene variable using a text expression, rather than a variable name.

Text expressions allows to enter the name of the variable with an expression like `"MyVar"+ ToString(Variable(Health))`
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ExtendedVariables
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Add conditions, actions and expressions to check for the existence of a variable, copy variables, delete existing ones from memory, and create dynamic variables.

eventsFunctions.description: Check if a global variable exists.
eventsFunctions.name: C_global_variable_exist

events.inlineCode:
const globalVariables = runtimeScene.getGame().getVariables();
eventsFunctionContext.returnValue = globalVariables.has(eventsFunctionContext.getArgument("GlobalVariableName"));

eventsFunctions.description: Check if a scene variable exists.
eventsFunctions.name: C_scene_variable_exist

events.inlineCode:
const sceneVariables = runtimeScene.getVariables();
eventsFunctionContext.returnValue = sceneVariables.has(eventsFunctionContext.getArgument("SceneVariableName"));

eventsFunctions.description: Check if an object variable exists.
eventsFunctions.name: C_object_variable_exist

eventsFunctions.description: Delete a global variable, removing it from memory.
eventsFunctions.name: A_Delete_global_variable

events.inlineCode: runtimeScene.getGame().getVariables().remove(eventsFunctionContext.getArgument("GlobalVariableName"));

parameters.description: Name of the global variable to delete
parameters.name: GlobalVariableName

eventsFunctions.description: Modify the text of a scene variable.
eventsFunctions.name: A_Modify_scene_variable_string
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the scene variable _PARAM1_ with text: _PARAM2_

events.inlineCode:
const variable = runtimeScene.getVariables().get(eventsFunctionContext.getArgument("SceneVariableName"));
variable.setString(eventsFunctionContext.getArgument("SceneVariableValue"));

eventsFunctions.description: Modify the text of a global variable.
eventsFunctions.name: A_Modify_global_variable_string
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the global variable _PARAM1_ with text: _PARAM2_

events.inlineCode:
const variable = runtimeScene.getGame().getVariables().get(eventsFunctionContext.getArgument("SceneVariableName"));
variable.setString(eventsFunctionContext.getArgument("SceneVariableValue"));

eventsFunctions.description: Modify the value of a global variable.
eventsFunctions.name: A_Modify_global_variable
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the global variable _PARAM1_ with value: _PARAM2_

events.inlineCode:
const variable = runtimeScene.getGame().getVariables().get(eventsFunctionContext.getArgument("SceneVariableName"));
variable.setNumber(eventsFunctionContext.getArgument("SceneVariableValue"));

eventsFunctions.description: Modify the value of a scene variable.
eventsFunctions.name: A_Modify_scene_variable
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the scene variable _PARAM1_ with value: _PARAM2_

events.inlineCode:
const variable = runtimeScene.getVariables().get(eventsFunctionContext.getArgument("SceneVariableName"));
variable.setNumber(eventsFunctionContext.getArgument("SceneVariableValue"));

eventsFunctions.description: Delete scene variable, the variable will be deleted from the memory.
eventsFunctions.name: A_Delete_scene_variable

events.inlineCode: runtimeScene.getVariables().remove(eventsFunctionContext.getArgument("SceneVariableName"));

parameters.description: Name of the scene variable to delete
parameters.name: SceneVariableName

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
When the checkbox is checked, the condition `Checked` is verified.
A halo appears when the mouse hovers near the checkbox.

Checkbox cannot be toggled by users if any of these are true:
- Checkbox is hidden
- Checkbox's layer is hidden
- Checkbox is disabled

Checkbox can always be changed by an action.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Checkbox
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Checkbox that can be toggled by a left-click or touch.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
Checkbox can be toggled by a left-click or touch. 

When the checkbox is checked, the condition `Checked` is TRUE.
A halo appears when the mouse hovers near the checkbox.

Checkbox cannot be toggled by users if any of these are true:
- Checkbox is hidden
- Checkbox's layer is hidden
- Checkbox is disabled

Checkbox can always be changed by an action.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: Checkbox

events.comment: Fix inputs that create malformed checkboxes
Change shape painter based on properties
Draw checkbox
Set halo radius, if not specified
Detect hover
Change shape painter for halo
Detect touch/click
Draw halo
Draw left-side of checkmark
Draw right-side of checkmark
